pkgmetadata.longdescription: [![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/navio-online/navio-aws.png?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/navio-online/navio-aws)AWS boto3 helper libs=====================## Features* Common use cases covered under single methods* Keeps build files clean and powerfull## InstallationYou can install navio-builder from the Python Package Index (PyPI) or from source.Using pip```bash$ pip install navio-aws```Using easy_install```bash$ easy_install navio-aws```## ExampleTODO## Contributors/ContributingIf you want to make changes the repo is at https://github.com/navio-online/navio-aws. You will need [pytest](http://www.pytest.org) to run the tests and [navio-builder](https://github.com/navio-online/navio-aws) tool to build modules```bash$ nb test```It will be great if you can raise a [pull request](https://help.github.com/articles/using-pull-requests) once you are done.If you find any bugs or need new features please raise a ticket in the [issues section](https://github.com/navio-online/navio-aws/issues) of the github repo. ## Licensenavio-travis is licensed under a [Apache 2.0 license](http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0)Changes =======0.1.0 - ??/12/2017------------------* Initial release.* CloudFormation API added
